name: The Turbulent Sixties Quiz | Nostalgia | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which of the following events occurred during the 60s?
questions.explanation:
Armstrong walks on the moon.

	The moon landing was in 1969. John Kennedy had pledged to put a man on the moon before the decade was over. It happened, but he didn't live to see it. The other events, Agnew resigning in disgrace and the Watergate fiasco, all happened in the 70s.

questions.text: Several young civil rights workers were murdered in the South during the early 60s. Where did this occur?
One of the most famous photographs from the era shows a young girl kneeling beside a student who had just been shot at Kent State. What was of particular interest about the girl?
options: She was a member of a prominent political family
She was a member of the military
questions.explanation:
She was a runaway.

	Mary Vecchio was a young runaway. (Kent State actually occurred in the 70s.)

questions.text: Which of these events did NOT occur in the 60s?
questions.explanation:
Shooting of George Wallace.

	Arthur Bremer's shooting of George Wallace was in the 70s. JFK was in 1963; the others were in the late 60s.

questions.text: Eugene McCarthy made a bid for the Presidency in 1968. What state did he represent as a Senator?
Which of the following is true of the Tate LaBianca murders?
questions.correct: The murder of Tate and her friends was followed later by the murder of the LaBianca's
options: Tate and the LaBianca's were murdered together at the LaBianca residence
The murder of the LaBianca's was followed later by the murder of Tate and her friends
Tate and the LaBianca's were murdered together at the Tate residence
questions.explanation:
The murder of Tate and her friends was followed later by the murder of the LaBianca's.

	Tate and friends were first, then the LaBianca two nights later. So sad.

questions.text: The Democratic convention of 1968 was a mess. Where was it held?
questions.explanation:
Chicago.

	Question: 'Do you belong to an organized political party?' Answer: 'No, I'm a Democrat.'

questions.text: Which of these events occurred in the 60s?
questions.explanation:
Boston Strangler killings.

	The Boston Strangler had his killing spree in the 60s. Berkowitz went on his rampage in the 70s. The Shepard and Clutter murders happened in the 50s. (Strange now to think about Robert Blake portraying a murderer in the movie version of Truman Capote's 'In Cold Blood'.)

questions.text: Barry Goldwater got clobbered when he ran for President in 1964. Who was his vice-presidential running mate?
questions.explanation:
Bill Miller.

	Lemay was the V.P. running mate of George Wallace in 1968. Anderson was a third party candidate for president in the election eventually won by Jimmy Carter in 1976. Rockefeller served for a short time as V.P.

questions.text: Who was the Soviet leader during the Cuban missile crisis of 1962?
questions.explanation:
Khrushchev.

	The other three were also Soviet political figures.
